conversations.content: Lady and the Beach: Part One
I am Cat Sìth. Lady Chelle and I have come to this beach resort in the midst of our summer vacation.
Meowr days have been packed to the brim. Lounging, shopping, dinner parties... The life of luxury can be so exhausting.
As an aside, I have never done well at these beaches. Why, mew ask? I should think it quite obvious.
Look at the waves washing up on the shore. The way they go forth and retract... Mrrr... The very sight has meow transfixed.
Oh! How unbecoming of meow. I must regain my senses and look elsewhere. There is something skittering about on the beach... Mrow?! It's a CRAB!
Mrow!!! It has so many legs! And it's snipping and snapping its claws! Meeeowww!
Oh! Goodness gracious, that was close... As mew can see, the beach is so full of little things moving about, it makes meow want to fool around like a little kitten.
While I believe in being free to do what one pleases, it is most unlike meow to roll around and frolic. Thus have I been forcing myself to resist my impulses, day in and day out.
＂Cat Sìth!＂ Why, it's Lady Chelle! ＂Is something the meowtter?＂
＂The lord of this land has invited us to a party.＂ I do so adore a good party! It's the purrfect place to observe how humans put on airs and deceive one another.
＂It will be tomorrow afternoon at a private beach to the east. Do be sure not to catnap through it.＂ A private...beach, she says?
＂Is something the matter? You seem awfully tense.＂ ＂Nyat at all! Purrish the thought.＂ ＂If you say so. At any rate, I look forward to your presence at the party.＂

This is quite the dilemma I find myself facing. But I am a lady. I am not one who will turn down a party because I fear losing myself to my base instincts. I am no scaredy-cat. ＂I'll show them what a dignified lady I am!＂
Lady and the Beach: Part Two
My summer vacation is in full swing. But the beach is rife with stimuli that tickle my instincts. Now Chelle and I will be attending a private beach party... Oh, what am I going to do?!
＂I am honored that you invited me here today.＂ ＂Why, Princess Chelle! I see you have brought your pactbound dragon with you.＂ ＂How do you do? I am Cat Sìth.＂
The party has begun. Waves kiss the shore. Seagulls soar lazily above as crabs dance among the shoals. My resolve weakens.
But I can handle this. I'm no stranger to fighting the impulse to play. Now, to follow Chelle, and... Hm?
There's something flitting about near her. ＂Chelle, there is a mosquito on mew.＂ ＂My word! I'm terribly sorry, Princess Chelle. Hey! The mosquito repellent's run out!＂
Goodness meow. What incompetent servants they are, allowing mosquitoes to sully this soiree! They scurry to light the incense once more. The scent is immewdiately, unmewstakably familiar.
In an instant, the scent envelops the beach. While it may be naught but a pleasant aroma to the human guests, I know exactly what it is.
C A T N I P! It certainly seems effective at driving the mosquitoes away, but it's also making meow lose all of my senses... Th-this is bad!
Meeeooowww... My vision grows hazy. The host, the guests, and even Chelle...
MROW! I JUST WANNA POUNCE ON EVERYTHING!
＂Cat Sìth? Is everything alright?＂  *gasp* What was I about to do?
Through my blurred vision, I can see Chelle. I know that she is not looking upon meow with concern. No, she is likely observing meow like a specimen in a lab.
My relationship with Chelle only extends to however long we are useful to one another. After all, the two of us are always looking out fur number one.
Our relationship is one of mutual convenience.  Yet this understanding is also something that brings us closer.
That is why I must compose myself. I cannot besmirch my nor Chelle's reputation—not if we wish to live a life untethered by others.
I cannot afford to lose face at an event this important.
*CHOMP!* I bite down on my tongue and the taste of blood spreads through my mouth. The sharp pain brings Chelle back into focus.
＂I'm fine. The heat was just getting to meow.＂ I deafen myself to catnip's siren call at last.
As we make our way home that evening, I see a stray cat playing with a crab on the beach. At this, Chelle says to me, ＂I never see YOU playing with anything, Cat Sìth. ＂
The devilish grin she sports is so purrfectly like her. I return a smirk of my own. ＂Do mew hear yourself?＂
＂I am no slave to my instincts. I am Cat Sìth, and I answer only to myself.＂
Chelle's grin widens. ＂Ever the stubborn one, you are.＂ ＂Mew are the last person I want to hear that from, Chelle.＂
As the sun sets along the beach, the two of us make our way home, hiding our true feelings behind matching, knowing smiles.
